headline.main: In Defense of a Giant (and Growing) Health Care Industry

docs.abstract: An economist points to one healthy sector in an unsettled economy.
docs.lead_paragraph: Editor's Note: Uwe E. Reinhardt, one of our Daily Economists, argues that in the midst of a slowing American economy, we should be grateful for a growing health care industry.If a Martian landed on earth and followed our debate on health care, he or she would conclude that the people on Earth are meshugge.
docs.snippet: An economist points to one healthy sector in an unsettled economy.

headline.main: Methane Bubbles, Farm Waste, Drilling Plans

docs.abstract: News Roundup, including Ecuador vote on giving nature "rights" in its constitution.
docs.lead_paragraph: The last 24 hours have been very busy on this pale blue dot. Joe Davis's valuable daily digest of environmental coverage for the Society of Environmental Journalists includes links to several significant news stories (see below), and in the meantime I'm querying methane and Arctic specialists about the startling story from The Independent (UK) on Tuesday reporting on a "methane time bomb" discovered by an international expedition along the continental shelf off Siberia.
docs.snippet: News Roundup, including Ecuador vote on giving nature "rights" in its constitution.

headline.seo: Mediterranean Diet Declines, and Weights Rise
headline.print_headline: Fast Food Hits Mediterranean; a Diet Succumbs
headline.main: Fast Food Hits Mediterranean; a Diet Succumbs

docs.lead_paragraph: Associated with lower rates of heart disease and cancer, the Mediterranean diet is in retreat in its home region.
docs.snippet: Associated with lower rates of heart disease and cancer, the Mediterranean diet is in retreat in its home region.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new university study financed by the Sugar Association is likely to fuel questions about the relationship between the private sector and academia.
docs.snippet: A new university study financed by the Sugar Association is likely to fuel questions about the relationship between the private sector and academia.

headline.seo: Banning Soda in Schools Has Little Impact on Students' Drinking Habits
headline.print_headline: Soda Ban in Schools Has Little Impact
headline.main: Nutrition: Soda Ban in Schools Has Little Impact

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that banning soft drink sales in elementary schools only slightly reduces how much soda children drink.
docs.snippet: A new study suggests that banning soft drink sales in elementary schools only slightly reduces how much soda children drink.
